chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan M Orta Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
It is the court's intention that the Department of Corrections can take 25% from all money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

CORRECTED 12-05-2015 TO MARK JOC JOINT AND SEVERAL

Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Do not associate with any gang members. No contact with victims or their families. No contact with co-actors. Must pay any child support obligations in effect. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey al rules and regulations while on supervision.

**AMENDED 1-7-2016 to add restitution.**
It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant Juan M Orta in court with attorney Paul Garland Bonneson.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 12-21-2015/tk
The Court is in receipt of PSI as well as numerous letters submitted by defense. The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed all documents referenced by the Court. No additions or corrections noted by the State. Defense puts a correction on the record. The State recommends 4-5 yrs IC, ES left up to the Court. State indicates restitution is requested in the amount in the excess of $8000.00. Victim was sent a letter to provide additional information to the State but the victim hasn't heard back from the victim yet. The second victim requests $528.96. 

BTC: Total sentence is 10 yrs WPS bifurcated as 5 yrs IC, 5 yrs ES/CFTS.     TAKEN INTO CUSTODY
